topic.title: Maybe anybody can help with a Zeronet blog problem
topic.body:
* I had cloned a blog and called it Kunterbunt
* Some days later I experienced trojan infection from an external Zeronet site which I could not get rid of.
* So I saved my users.json file and erased all zeronet folders and re-installed Zeronet
* Then I copied my saved users.json fild back to the new folders
* Since then I cannot edit my blog Kunterbunt
* And: from another computer at home I can access Kunterbunt and can add new entries to the blog.
* But: Although I clicked on Kunterbunt "update" on both computers I cannot see the new blog entry on the computer where I re-installed Zeronet: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18SUBtcYrBuCKBAnDzaMResafL2JeD2hhQ/?Post:12:Schnell+mal+ein+Buch+schreiben:+NaNoWriMo
* What am I doing wrong?

1525079754_1Nyvgpgzk7BEEHs1TeTRwAtEDhF2t.body: Ho jes, ankaŭ Esperantistoj estas  ĉi tie :-)

1535213599_1CF7NrguXy6cEycDkSRd3CUFekLur.body:
> [eibriel](#comment_68_1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi): Since gods existence is a matter of faith. And faith does not require rationale.And you cant contradict a non rationale believe with rationality.Then any answer to your inquiry will be based on faith. [...]

Quite right. What we need instead is a discussion about how believers and nonbelievers can coexist. Look e.g. at the blog posts between Andrew Murtagh and Adam Lee.

1539101626_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbE.body: It needs a lot of work still to develop nice apps for Solid. Let's do it.

> [shibeotp](#comment_3_13fF8ReM7zvX4ytjPkwEaRtBbtFKeho7XS): It needs a lot of time to be SOLID xD

. . .  and enough of knowhow . . .

> [shibeotp](#comment_5_13fF8ReM7zvX4ytjPkwEaRtBbtFKeho7XS): I would prefer to have the possibility to have my data in a server at home,

No problem I think. You can install your own POD server at home.

> [ornataweaver](#comment_21_139zVkd4AsZqs9qSYk6ypPDAqDcjPCmRm4): Thank you for introducing it. https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web

There you can chat with Tim Berners-Lee and his fellows about the idea and how to have a first try on Solid: https://gitter.im/solid/chat

1540357812_1LiBAqfmPSAEhoFj2fM3iMEZe5uzZ.body: Then please have a look at a project which tries to remedy this: https://solid.mit.edu/

1540443278_1LiBAqfmPSAEhoFj2fM3iMEZe5uzZ.body: The Solid Project from Tim Berners-Lee tries to build another structure: https://solid.mit.edu/

1542892944_1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJx.body:
Thanks to all for the hint: "my site" did it! Now I can edit the blog from computer A. My added post from commputer B got lost this way, so I have to write it again. And also strange: On computer A I added this topic here to Zerotalk. But: Your comments I see only on computer B. Computer A sees 0 comments yet :-(
So I write this from computer B.
And: It's a pity but I forgot which external site had the trojan :-(

And one more question: On Computer B on the left side of the screen I have a mask: "Filter: Site name"
This mask is absent on computer A. Can I configure that?

> [kai0](#comment_722_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): 很旧的版本没有"Filter: Site name"，更新了版本就会有"Filter: Site name"的。

Ah, thank you. On computer A (without Filter) I have re-installed Zeronet very recently. Maybe I got an older version of the software there? Where can I find the freshest one?
